content.description: This route is a classic!!! Every size of hands from thin to cupped. Three roofs: a 16 inch roof squeeze that protects with a #6, a thin splitter hands, and finish with a roof...
content.protection: (5) #1's (5) #2's (1) #3 (1) #6 and some slings for the roofs
content.location: At the top of the trail to the left of Sweet Hog

content.description: Thin hands off the ground in to a crusher fists an big hand stacks for a stretch then the crack arches to the right a little an pinches down to thin hands before it disappears all together an some face holds show up an you quest to the chains..
content.location: Right at the top of the trail..

content.description:
This climb has a few cruxes. Pulling through the initial squeeze to what feels like a 6 inch roof, requires some "try hard" for any sized body. Towards the top, the edge is sharp and thin, place gear deep if you have to and be mindful if you jam.

This climb required a lot of cleaning and spit me out the first time I tried it, leaving my belayer with a rock to the ribs. Second round took blood, but the climb is clean.
content.protection: 2 each: #3's, #4s, #5's, and #6's. 1 each: red metolius, light blue metolius, #2 and #1. (#3.5 is an awesome replacement for a #4 if you have it)
content.location: This climb is to the right of Like a horse and Strange Magic and to the left of My Little Ponytails.

content.description: 00s off the ground in to some tight tips with some wild stemming to a roof with a lone jam. Reach up out over the roof on some great jugs in to a finger crack that goes to the anchors.
content.protection: (4) green alien size cams (2) .4 Camalots (1) #2 hand-sized piece and a .5 for the top.
content.location: On the right side of the wall

content.description: Amazing overhanging arch that's about 5 inches with ripples on the wall for feet. The bottom flake and last 10ft of the climb are thin hands.
content.protection: One each of .5 cam, red metolius and green metolius. 2 each of  black metolius, #3's, # 4's and #5's. On sight first assent used an old #4 and #3.5 in addition to this gear, but its possible to use similar sizes. (Be mindful placing gear in the flake at the bottom it's thin in places.)
content.location: Strange Magic is visible at the top of the trail to the right of Little Magic and to the left of Like a Horse and Ride the Pony.

content.description: Start on top of the little bench thin hands to some ring locks into some sequential fingers with an occasional pod to a horizontal rail to some tips and face moves to the anchors
content.location: To the left of standard 510 up on the little bench. Its the finger splitter to the left at the top of the trail and you can't miss it.

content.description: Tips is a flair with some stemming to a cool bolder move at the top ... Fun lil climb..
content.location: To the right look for the brown open book with some great rings up top

content.description: A short but sweet splitter hand crack. Plaque says 5.10 but 5.9 seems more accurate to me. Tight hands to hands. A quality beginner route.
content.location: Far right side of High Horse, right of One Trick Pony. Look for a short straight in splitter with a narrow dirt ramp leading in from the right.

content.description: Sustained, slightly overhanging fists/off fists. Challenging for small hands. Crux is pulling through the wide section.
content.location: At the top of the trail to the right of Sweat Hog and to the left of Strange Magic.

content.description: Start in the back of a cave with perfect #6's over yer head OW out the cave pull the roof of the cave in to #5's splitter that gose on down to .5 Camalot.. Black an crisp an fun all day!
content.location: To the right at the top of the trail up to the left on a fallen piller

content.description: Boulder move right off the ground into a .3 size crack that switches corners with the help of a jug out on the face and ripples out to the right for your feet. Mantel onto a ledge with a #3 placement into ring locks and thin hands for 30 feet into a stem box with a OW finish
content.location: On the far right next to One Trick Pony

content.description: This is a beast of an OW climb, there are about 5 roofs to pass, some as wide as 6 inches. The cruxes will be different for everyone based on size. Very challenging for small hands. I was shut down brutally my first attempt climbing it, but got the red point on the next trip after being humbled and loosing some skin.
content.protection: 2 of each: #2's, #3's, #4's. 3 of both: #5's and #6's are ideal. You could also use a blue and gold choke tube.
content.location: Turn left at the top of the trail and it's to the left of Standard (an impossible to miss splitter) and to the far right of Be a Unicorn.

content.description: Scramble up some soft stone clip a  protection bolt ( I hand drilled on lead)  some scrappy moves will get you to the base of a huge boombbay flare that you can stuff a #6 in the back of some real savage OW will get you to some great chains..
content.location: Left of not named about 20 yd's

content.description: An overhanging OW with huecos that makes it the perfect climb for those trying to learn OW techniques with jug rests!
content.location: To the right of Ride the Pony and to the left of My Little Pony Tail.

content.description: Gain a little ledge and jam one of three cracks up a flare for 30 feet until two of  the cracks disappear. Continue up a 6 inch crack with thin hands in the back that you can reach if you're skinny. Pull out of the 6 inch flare to a diagonal cupped hands crack to the anchor.
content.location: From the top of the trail, go to the right up on the same little pedestal as Like a Horse

content.description: Splitter hands to cupped hands fists through a roof diagonal hands back to steeper #3's down to tight #2's!! Pack a lunch
content.protection: #1's up to #4's heavy on the 3's an 4's
content.location: From the top of the trail go left you can't miss it... It's a huge splitter!!!

content.description: This arch has a little bit for everyone, from wide to thin hands and even a few ring locks. You can reach the rim...please be mindful of the crypto!
content.protection: Take 2: #5's, #3's, #2's, #1's, 2 black metolius and 1 #6. (on sight FA gear used)
content.location: Far left side of the wall passed Horsasaurus and a finger crack, head through a rock tunnel to find the start of the climb.

content.description: This FA was a fight...the crux is the layback coming out from the squeeze through the roof. I bent the axil of a #6 whipping out of this.
content.protection: I used double rack from #2-#6 BD cams.
content.location: To the left of Hoof Prints and to the right of Ride the Pony.
